intro: Geranium cazorlense, commonly known as the Sicilian geranium, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of pink or red flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a slightly rough texture, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Geranium cazorlense is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and hardiness.
